abstract:
To run a Dockerfile and then run the Docker container built from it, you typically follow these steps:

Write a Dockerfile: This file contains instructions for building your Docker image. It specifies the base image, adds any dependencies, sets environment variables, and configures the container.

Build the Docker image: You use the docker build command to build the Docker image from your Dockerfile. This command creates a Docker image based on the instructions in your Dockerfile.

Run the Docker container: Once you have built the Docker image, you use the docker run command to run a container based on that image.
